events.description: Headquarters First Canadian Army (General Crerar) was to take the field on 23rd July, when it would assume responsibility for the extreme left flank sector, taking xr Corps under command. 2 Canadian Corps was to remain under Second Army for the moment. events.title: Seventh Army Advances Eastward: General Patton Intensifies Push Along North Coast
events.description: Seventh Army in the meantime was pushing eastwards along the north coast. This was in accordance with my directive of 23rd July which called for the maximum presSure in this area. General Patton calculated that he

events.title: Power Struggle in Djibouti: General Germain Takes Command Amidst Resistance from Legentilhomme
events.description: 17. On 15th July General Germain, who had been sent by the French Government by plane to Italian East Africa to take over command from General Legentilhomme, arrived at the outposts of Jibuti. He was refused admittance by General Legentilhomme, who was still determined to continue the fight. On 2and July, however, General Legentilhomme was ove! at a Council at which he announced his intention to the Civil authorities, and. found himself unable to enforce his decision without bringing on an internal armed conflict. On 23rd July General Germain entered Jibuti and assumed office as Governor and Commander of the troops. On 27th July the French detachpent which held the Pass of Jirre was with-

events.title: Fulmars' Daring Defense: Enemy Aircraft Thwarted, Convoy Safely Reaches Destination
events.description: (a) Effective work of Fulmars. The Fulmars of ARK ROYAL contributed in no small measure to the safe arrival of the convoy at its destination. On 23rd July formations of enemy aircraft were intercepted on three occasions. On the first occasion, two were shot down for certain and another two probably destroyed, whilst the suryivors which reached the fleet were in no state to carry out an accurate attack. On the second occasion, as the Fulmars were about to intercept, the bombers released their bombs on the destroyer screen and immediately withdrew. Finally an attempted T/B attack was completely broken up and driven off, leaving two aircraft shot down with another damaged and possibly lost.

events.title: Mysterious Hovemanls Captured at Dawn: July 23rd Unveils Secrets
Force X Dodges Attacks Thanks to Improved Malta Beaufighter Support
events.description: 93. Force X had a few air alarms during the evening of the 24th but no attacks developed, probably due to better support from the Malta Beaufighters which, largely due to inexperience, had given me cause for anxiety by their performance on 23rd July during the approach to Malta.*

Adventure Sets Sail: Arrives at Seidisfiord Before Force P
events.description: 4. ADVENTURE left Scapa  at 0030  on 23rd July and arrived at Seidisfiord before Force   P .

events.title: Devonshire Fleet Sets Sail from Scapa: A Bold Voyage Begins
events.description: 5. Force  P , eonidedos of DEVONSHIRE, SUFFOLK, ~ FURIOUS, VICTORIOUS, INTREPID, _ ESCAPADE, ' ANTHONY, ACHATES, ACTIVE and ANTELOPE, sailed from Scapa at 2300 on Wednesday, 23rd July, and proceeded at .20 knots to Seidishord.
